intro: Caiophora andina, commonly known as the Andean caiophora, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations ranging from 3,000 to 5,000 meters. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits containing seeds. Due to its unique habitat and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
